title: Vintage Greta Garbo/Movie fonts
content:
Hi y’all

Was trying to figure out weather it might be anything like the Garbo script available, can’t seem to find anything matching it...  
Also interested in the other font in the same image.

Any ideas?

Thanks,  
Dana

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [Garbo.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20090914152654/http:/typophile.com/files/Garbo.jpg) | 71.44 KB |
author: dana321

comments.content:
This is was hand done so it’s not a font.

You might like the work of Ale Paul:  
 [http://new.myfonts.com/foundry/Sudtipos/](http://web.archive.org/web/20090914152654/http:/new.myfonts.com/foundry/Sudtipos/ "http://new.myfonts.com/foundry/Sudtipos/")

Hah! I bet this is the very snapshot [I took](http://web.archive.org/web/20090914152654/http:/www.flickr.com/photos/stewf/2186292033/). I love the script too, Dana. Nearly any film titles from that period were drawn by hand. Like Mike suggests, have a look at Ale Paul’s digitization of the [Bleumlein scripts](http://web.archive.org/web/20090914152654/http:/sudtipos.com/home) (right column) which were lettering styles of the era. You might like [Matinee Idol](http://web.archive.org/web/20090914152654/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/comicraft/matinee_idol/) too.

[Miss Stanfort](http://web.archive.org/web/20090914152654/http:/www.veer.com/partner/link.aspx?i=1048&c=4&p=products/typedetail.aspx?image=UMT0000089) might be the best match stylistically but the lowercase is much smaller.
[Modified Gothic](http://web.archive.org/web/20090914152654/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/linotype_library/modified_gothic_regular/) gets you close to the sans.
